Submodules¶

investos.portfolio.controller module¶

class investos.portfolio.controller.Controller(df_forecast: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, df_actual: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame | None = None, strategy: ~investos.portfolio.strategy.base_strategy.BaseStrategy = <class 'investos.portfolio.strategy.rank_long_short.RankLongShort'>, backtest_model: ~investos.portfolio.result.base_result.BaseResult | None = None, initial_portfolio: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame | None = None, aum: float = 100000000, df_categories: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame | None = None, start_date=None, end_date=None, after_step: [typing.Callable] = [], config: dict = {}, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Container class that runs backtests using passed-in portfolio optimization strategy (see BaseStrategy), then saves results into passed-in result (see Result) class.

Parameters:

  • df_forecast (pd.DataFrame) –

    DataFrame of forecast asset returns for backtest period.

    Expected columns: asset (unique ID/ticker), date (datetime), return (float)

  • df_actual (pd.DataFrame) –

    DataFrame of actual asset returns for backtest period. Used to create forecasts for std_dev, spread, and volume if forecasts not given.

    Expected columns: asset (unique ID/ticker), date (datetime), price (float), return (float), volume (of shares traded, float), spread (float)

  • strategy (BaseStrategy) – Optimization strategy used by backtester. Used to determine what trades to make at each forecast time period.

  • backtest_model (BaseResult) – Stores result from simulated backtest, and contains convenience properties and methods for reporting.

  • initial_portfolio (pd.DataFrame, optional) – Initial portfolio values in dollars (or other currency), not in weights.

  • aum (float, optional) – Total assets under management, in dollars (or other currency).

  • df_categories (pd.DataFrame, optional) – Additional category data for assets. Used by certain optimization strategies.

  • config (dict, optional) – Configuration parameters.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

config¶

Configuration parameters after merging with base configuration.

Type:

dict

strategy¶

Optimization strategy used by backtester.

Type:

BaseStrategy

backtest_model¶

Stores result from simulated backtest.

Type:

BaseResult

forecast¶

Holds the pivoted and filled forecast DataFrames.

Type:

dict

actual¶

Holds the pivoted and filled actual DataFrames, if provided.

Type:

dict

initial_portfolio¶

Initial portfolio values, including cash.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

after_step¶

Callable objects, that are passed a reference to Controller (i.e. self), that run at end of each step through time

Type:

[Callable]

generate_positions(self):

Optimizes the portfolio and backtests it. Returns BaseResult object.

pivot_and_fill(self, df: pd.DataFrame, values: str, columns='asset', index='date', fill_method='bfill'):

Pivots and fills the DataFrame based on the provided values, columns, and index.

create_forecast(self, df_forecast: pd.DataFrame, col_name: str = 'std_dev'):

Creates a forecast DataFrame based on the provided df_forecast and col_name.

create_price(self, df_return: pd.DataFrame):

Creates price data based on provided return data and last historical price.

create_initial_portfolio(self, initial_portfolio, aum):

Creates the initial portfolio based on provided initial portfolio (or aum value if iniitial portfolio not provided).

get_actual_positions_for_t(self, h: pd.Series, u: pd.Series, t: dt.Series):

Gets actual portfolio positions and holdings for time period t, given trades u, and associates cost models and returns.

Args:

h: pandas Series object describing current portfolio u: n pandas Series vector with stock trades t: current datetime

Returns:

h_next: pandas Series portfolio after returns propagation (for t to t+1 period) u: pandas Series trades vector with simulated cash balance

get_initial_t(self):

Gets the initial time period for the backtest.

BASE_CONFIG = {'borrowing': {'interest_rate': 0.005, 'short_rate': 0.005}, 'forecast': {'half_spread': {'calc_from_n_prev_periods': 100}, 'std_dev': {'calc_from_n_prev_periods': 100}, 'volume': {'calc_from_n_prev_periods': 100}}}¶
